hero.title: PlantData
hero.description: Plant Data is an inter-university research center devoted to plant diversity and big data, founded in 2021. Plant Data aims at studying novel approaches and develop new tools for producing, managing and analysing plant biodiversity data.

about-us.title: Who are we
about-us.description: Plant Data was originally founded by a core group of six Italian universities: Bologna, Camerino, Perugia, Pisa, Roma (La Sapienza), Trieste.

resources.title: Resources
resources.description: Plant Data contributes to the development of several resources, from databases to tools for research data retrieval. These resources are and will be always available online to everybody.

floritaly.title: Floritaly
floritaly.description: FlorItaly organises nomenclatural and distributional data from the recent checklists of the Italian native and alien vascular plants (and their subsequent updates), with links to resources from other projects.

wikiplantbase.title: WikiPlantBase
wikiplantbase.description: The Wikiplantbase #Italia project intends to foster the collection of and access to floristic data for Italy, with a freely accessible interface open to everyone's contribution.

italic.title: Italic
italic.description: ITALIC, the Information System on Italian Lichens, makes available data and digital resources. Most of the data are derived from the Checklist by Nimis (2016) and are being continuously updated online. ITALIC also exposes digital identification keys.

github.title: GitHub
github.description: Plant Data is an open source project. All the code is available on GitHub.

contacts.title: Contacts
contacts.description: For information on Plant Data you can contact the coordinator, prof. Stefano Martellos (martelst@units.it) or the secretary, prof. Jury Nascimbene (juri.nascimbene@unibo.it).
